abstract: South Korean hacking specialist found dead of apparent suicide and identified only by surname Lim left suicide note denying his involvement in spying on citizens' cellphone or online communications.
lead_paragraph: A 45-year-old specialist with the National Intelligence Service who was found dead in his car left a note denying his team spied on South Korean citizens, the police said.

headline.main: In Suicide Note, South Korea Hacking Expert Denies Domestic Spying
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; South Korea: Agent’s Suicide Note Contains Denial of Domestic Spying

snippet: A 45-year-old specialist with the National Intelligence Service who was found dead in his car left a note denying his team spied on South Korean citizens, the police said.
